# is-number

[![NPM version](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/is-number.svg?style=flat)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/is-number)
[![NPM monthly downloads](https://img.shields.io/npm/dm/is-number.svg?style=flat)](https://npmjs.org/package/is-number)
[![NPM total downloads](https://img.shields.io/npm/dt/is-number.svg?style=flat)](https://npmjs.org/package/is-number)
[![Linux Build Status](https://img.shields.io/travis/jonschlinkert/is-number.svg?style=flat&label=Travis)](https://travis-ci.org/jonschlinkert/is-number)

> Returns true if the value is a finite number.

Please consider following the project's author, [Jon Schlinkert](https://github.com/jonschlinkert), and starring the project to show your support.

## Install

```bash
$ npm install --save is-number
```

## Usage

```javascript
const isNumber = require('is-number');

console.log(isNumber(5e3)); // true
console.log(isNumber(NaN)); // false
console.log(isNumber('0xff')); // true
console.log(isNumber('foo')); // false
console.log(isNumber(Infinity)); // false
console.log(isNumber(null)); // false
```

## Why is this needed?

In JavaScript, checking if a value is a number can be tricky due to edge cases involving string representation of numbers, and type coercion.  `+` and `Number()` can yield unexpected results.  `is-number` provides a robust and reliable solution.

## API

`isNumber(value)`

- Returns `true` if the input `value` is a finite number.
- Returns `false` for all other types of values (including `Infinity`, `NaN`, null, undefined, strings, objects, etc.)
- Handles various input formats, including strings representing numbers (e.g., "0xff").

## Release History

* **7.0.0:** Refactor. Uses `.isFinite` if available for better performance with non-string/non-number inputs, roughly 3x-4x faster.
* **6.0.0:** Optimizations.
* **5.0.0:** Breaking change: Removed support for `instanceof Number` and `instanceof String`.

## Benchmarks

See the [benchmarks](./benchmark/index.js) for details.  These benchmarks show `is-number` consistently performs well compared to other approaches.
